definition: to build/to construct/to ram/to hit/Taiwan pr. [zhu2]
short name for Guiyang 貴陽|贵阳[Gui4 yang2]
tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
lit. build a high desk of debt (idiom); heavily in debt

pinyin: An1 hui1 Jian4 zhu4 Gong1 ye4 Xue2 yuan4

definition: variant of 版築|版筑[ban3 zhu4]

sentences.english: And he built an altar there to the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 也在那裏審判以色列人，且爲耶和華築了一座壇。

sentences.english: My grandparents built a bamboo fence around their house.
sentences.chinese: 我的外公外婆在房子周圍築了一道竹籬。

sentences.english: They dug through the mountain to build a tunnel.
sentences.chinese: 他們掘穿大山築一條隧道。

sentences.english: Tokyo's election has divided the fishmongers of Tsukiji.
sentences.chinese: 東京的選舉把築地的魚販分化了。

sentences.english: The best rice land is level, conveniently diked for alternating irrigation and drainage.
sentences.chinese: 稻田最好是在平地上，築田埂以利排灌。

sentences.english: All the strategic passes in the mountains are fortified.
There he built an altar to the Lord and called on the name of the Lord .
sentences.chinese: 他在那裏又爲耶和華築了一座壇，求告耶和華的名。

sentences.english: The nest of a bird, such as an eagle, built on a cliff or other high place.
sentences.chinese: 猛禽的巢鳥巢，如鷹巢，築於懸崖或其他高處。

sentences.english: Oo-ah, Mother should I build a wall?
sentences.chinese: 媽媽，我應該築一堵牆起來嗎？

sentences.english: Then I dug a ditch that could hold many seeds around the altar.
sentences.chinese: 接着我在祭臺周圍築了一個可以裝滿許多種子的渠道。

sentences.english: Moses built an altar and called it The Lord is my Banner.
sentences.chinese: 摩西築了一座祭壇，給它起名叫“耶和華尼西”。

sentences.english: The troops received orders to trench the outpost .
sentences.chinese: 部隊接到命令在前哨周圍築壕加強防衛。

sentences.english: So he built an altar there to the Lord , who had appeared to him.
sentences.chinese: 亞伯蘭就在那裏爲向他顯現的耶和華築了一座壇。

sentences.english: The goalkeeper organizing to build up a wall.
sentences.chinese: 守門員正在組織築人牆。

sentences.english: Our forefathers built this wall to defend them-selves from invasion.
sentences.chinese: 我們的祖先築這座長城是爲了防禦侵略的。

definition: to construct/to form/to make up/to compose/literary composition/paper mulberry (Broussonetia papyrifera)
to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display
building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
